Articles.Content: Danny2462 is back with another game-breaking video. As he shoots Kerbals out of the known universe and then into the Sun it is of course only a matter of time before the Kraken shows up.

FIRST!

and also cool vid danny ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Whenever I find a bug, my reaction is usually "Oh, I'd better avoid using those parts together in this configuration"

Danny's is "Ooh, I'll add some parts which were buggy in this config and add them on to this buggy thing!!"
The music, the action, all I can say is ,,,OMG!
Salute, Danny! It's a fine service you provide to the community - murdering poor Kerbals in amusing ways for those of us who can't bear to! :-}
Danny, get back on your forum account and thank Squad even more than you are!

> 
> Whenever I find a bug, my reaction is usually "Oh, I'd better avoid using those parts together in this configuration"
> Danny's is "Ooh, I'll add some parts which were buggy in this config and add them on to this buggy thing!!"

I swear, these things keep getting more and more game breaking! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Well, I guess SQUAD needs to add stronger bolts to the MK1 lander can door ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Every KSP player sees m for metres. Anyone going into a high Kerbin orbit sees K for kilometres. Everyone who reaches a solar orbit sees M for Megametres. Anyone who sends a ship onto a solar escape trajectory and waits long enough will see G for Gigametres. People abusing physics might well see T for Terametres. What most people don't know is that KSP also has P for Petametres, E for Exametres, Z for Zettametres, Y for Yottametres and X for eXtreme distances (I don't think there's a name for that, and it's not an SI prefix), but then it loops back round to m again.

The logical reason is that the letter comes at the end of a line of numbers. Since we use the decimal system, each number has ten possible values (0-9)

Look at the list of prefixes: m, k, M, G, T, P, E, Z, Y, X. That's ten. Having ten values probably made it easier to code, and I doubt the dev who wrote it (presumably Harvester) thought a value of 999999X (~10^33 m) would be too small. The real-life observable universe wouldn't even need the Y on KSP's scale. Radius of approx. 440000Z on KSP's scale.
Welcome back Danny! Looking forward to any and all content in the future!

> 
> Whenever I find a bug, my reaction is usually "Oh, I'd better avoid using those parts together in this configuration"
> Danny's is "Ooh, I'll add some parts which were buggy in this config and add them on to this buggy thing!!"

[https://xkcd.com/242/](https://xkcd.com/242/)

At 1:25, Jebediah went 550,654 exameters, which equals:

550,654,000,000,000,000,000 meters

58,204,173.7 light years! ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

That's almost 5 times the distance to the Andromeda Galaxy!
